ul.li: "Production and Transportation Integration for a Make-to-Order Manufacturing Company with a Commit-to-Delivery Business Mode," (with Dr. Kathryn E. Stecke), submitted to Management Science.

"Managing the Technology of Integrating the Production and Transportation Functions in Assembly or Flow Operations for Make-to-order Industries, "(with Dr. Kathryn E. Stecke), PICMET best paper award in 2005 .
"Lead Time and Price Quotation Mode Selection: Uniform or Differentiated?" (with Dr. Kathryn E. Stecke and Dr. Ashutosh Prasad), submitted to Management Science.
"Revenue Sharing Contract with Service Level Constraint" (with Dr. Kathryn E. Stecke and Casey Chung), working in progress.

subsection.p: Lead time reliability project for Dell, Ltd.

ul.li: Analyzed 667,732 orders and figured out three key factors which are responsible for major delivery delay. Dell executive managers are very satisfied with and surprised by this finding.
Analyzed the Dell production process in detail and pointed out the problems together with suggestions.
Analyzed Dell customer segmentation and suggested potential 3 profit growing points.

Ph.D level: Stochastic Processes, Optimal Control Theory, Deterministic Models in Operations Research, Network Flow, Advanced Topics in Supply Chain Management, Game theory, Dynamic Programming, Advanced Stochastic Inventory Control and Flexible Manufacturing System.

Masters Level: Probability and Stochastic theory, Statistics, Financial Accounting, Financial Management, Inventory Control, Industrial Application of SCM, Logistics, MIS Foundation, Capstone Projects in SCM, Distributed Database, Datamining, Parallel Computing.
